intro: Echinochloa hirta, commonly known as hairy barnyardgrass, is an annual grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown spikelets. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural fields. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a challenging species to control in crops.
